verses.verse: And the people<WH5971> were as murmurers<WH596>, speaking evil in the ears<WH7451> of Jehovah<WH3068>: and when Jehovah<WH3068> heard<WH8085> it<WH639>, his anger was kindled<WH2734>; and the fire<WH784> of Jehovah<WH3068> burnt<WH1197> among them<WH398>, and devoured in the uttermost part<WH7097> of the camp<WH4264>.
And the people<WH5971> cried<WH6817> unto Moses<WH4872>; and Moses<WH4872> prayed<WH6419> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and the fire<WH784> abated<WH8257>.
And the<WH1931> name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> was called<WH7121> Taberah<WH8404>, because the fire<WH784> of Jehovah<WH3068> burnt among them<WH1197>.

And the mixed multitude<WH628> that was among<WH7130> them lusted<WH183> exceedingly<WH1121>: and the children of Israel<WH3478> also wept<WH1058> again<WH7725>, and said<WH559>, Who shall give us flesh<WH1320> to eat<WH398>?

We remember<WH2142> the fish<WH1710>, which we did eat<WH398> in Egypt<WH4714> for nought<WH2600>; the cucumbers<WH7180>, and the melons<WH20>, and the leeks<WH2682>, and the onions<WH1211>, and the garlic<WH7762>:
but now our soul<WH5315> is dried away<WH3002>; there is nothing at all save<WH1115> this manna<WH4478> to look upon<WH5869>.
And the manna<WH4478> was like coriander<WH1407> seed<WH2233>, and the appearance<WH5869> thereof as the appearance<WH5869> of bdellium<WH916>.

The people<WH5971> went about<WH7751>, and gathered<WH3950> it<WH2912>, and ground it in mills<WH7347>, or beat<WH1743> it in mortars<WH4085>, and boiled<WH1310> it in pots<WH6517>, and made<WH6213> cakes<WH5692> of it<WH2940>: and the taste of it was as the taste<WH2940> of fresh<WH3955> oil<WH8081>.
And when the dew<WH2919> fell<WH3381> upon the camp<WH4264> in the night<WH3915>, the manna<WH4478> fell upon it<WH3381>.

And Moses<WH4872> heard<WH8085> the people<WH5971> weeping<WH1058> throughout their families<WH4940>, every man<WH376> at the door<WH6607> of his tent<WH168>: and the anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> greatly<WH3966>; and Moses<WH4872> was displeased<WH7489>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, Wherefore hast thou dealt ill<WH7489> with thy servant<WH5650>? and wherefore have I not found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, that thou layest<WH7760> the burden<WH4853> of all this people upon me<WH5971>?

Have I conceived<WH2029> all this people<WH5971>? have I brought them forth<WH3205>, that thou shouldest say<WH559> unto me<WH5375>, Carry them in thy bosom<WH2436>, as a nursing-father<WH539> carrieth<WH5375> the sucking child<WH3243>, unto the land<WH127> which thou swarest<WH7650> unto their fathers<WH1>?
Whence <WH370> should I have flesh<WH1320> to give<WH5414> unto all this people<WH5971>? for they weep<WH1058> unto me<WH559>, saying, Give<WH5414> us flesh<WH1320>, that we may eat<WH398>.
I am not able<WH3201> to bear<WH5375> all this people<WH5971> alone<WH905>, because it is too heavy for me<WH3515>.

And if thou deal<WH6213> thus with me<WH2026>, kill me<WH2026>, I pray thee, out of hand, if I have found<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>; and let me not see<WH7200> my wretchedness<WH7451>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Gather<WH622> unto me seventy<WH7657> men<WH376> of the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>, whom thou knowest<WH3045> to be the elders<WH2205> of the people<WH5971>, and officers<WH7860> over them<WH3947>; and bring them unto the tent<WH168> of meeting<WH4150>, that they may stand there with thee<WH3320>.

And I will come down<WH3381> and talk<WH1696> with thee there<WH680>: and I will take of the Spirit<WH7307> which is upon thee<WH7760>, and will put it upon them<WH5375>; and they shall bear the burden<WH4853> of the people<WH5971> with thee<WH5375>, that thou bear it not thyself alone.

And say<WH559> thou unto the people<WH5971>, Sanctify<WH6942> yourselves against to-morrow<WH4279>, and ye shall eat<WH398> flesh<WH1320>; for ye have wept<WH1058> in the ears<WH241> of Jehovah<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Who shall give us flesh<WH1320> to eat<WH398>? for it was well<WH2895> with us in Egypt<WH4714>: therefore Jehovah<WH3068> will give<WH5414> you flesh<WH1320>, and ye shall eat<WH398>.
Ye shall not eat<WH398> one<WH259> day<WH3117>, nor two days<WH3117>, nor five<WH2568> days<WH3117>, neither ten<WH6235> days<WH3117>, nor twenty<WH6242> days<WH3117>,

but a whole month<WH2320>, until it come out<WH3318> at your nostrils<WH639>, and it be loathsome<WH2214> unto you<WH3282>; because that ye have rejected<WH3988> Jehovah<WH3068> who is among<WH7130> you<WH1058>, and have wept before<WH6440> him<WH559>, saying, Why came we forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>?

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, The people<WH5971>, among<WH7130> whom I am<WH8337>, are six hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> footmen<WH7273>; and thou hast said<WH559>, I will give<WH5414> them flesh<WH1320>, that they may eat<WH398> a whole<WH3117> month<WH2320>.

Shall flocks<WH6629> and herds<WH1241> be slain<WH7819> for them<WH4672>, to suffice them<WH1709>? or shall all the fish of the sea<WH3220> be gathered together<WH622> for them<WH4672>, to suffice them?

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Is Jehovah<WH3068>'s hand<WH3027> waxed short<WH7114>? now shalt thou see<WH7200> whether my word<WH1697> shall come to pass unto thee or not<WH7136>.

And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318>, and told<WH1696> the people<WH5971> the words<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>: and he gathered<WH622> seventy<WH7657> men<WH376> of the elders<WH2205> of the people<WH5971>, and set<WH5975> them round about<WH5439> the Tent<WH168>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> came down<WH3381> in the cloud<WH6051>, and spake<WH1696> unto him<WH680>, and took of the Spirit<WH7307> that was upon him<WH5414>, and put it upon the seventy<WH7657> elders<WH2205>: and it came to pass<WH7307>, that, when the Spirit rested<WH5117> upon them<WH5012>, they prophesied, but they did so no more<WH3254>.

But there remained<WH7604> two<WH8147> men<WH582> in the camp<WH4264>, the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Eldad<WH419>, and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH8145> Medad<WH4312>: and the Spirit<WH7307> rested<WH5117> upon them<WH3789>; and they were of them that were written, but had not gone out<WH3318> unto the Tent<WH168>; and they prophesied<WH5012> in the camp<WH4264>.
And there ran<WH7323> a young man<WH5288>, and told<WH5046> Moses<WH4872>, and said<WH559>, Eldad<WH419> and Medad<WH4312> do prophesy<WH5012> in the camp<WH4264>.

And Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, the minister<WH8334> of Moses<WH4872>, one of his chosen men<WH979>, answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, My lord<WH113> Moses<WH4872>, forbid them<WH3607>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto him<WH7065>, Art thou jealous for my sake<WH5414>? would that all Jehovah<WH3068>'s people<WH5971> were prophets<WH5030>, that Jehovah<WH3068> would put<WH5414> his Spirit upon them<WH7307>!
And Moses<WH4872> gat<WH622> him into the camp<WH4264>, he and the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>.

And there went forth<WH5265> a wind<WH7307> from Jehovah<WH3068>, and brought<WH1468> quails<WH7958> from the sea<WH3220>, and let them fall<WH5203> by the camp<WH4264>, about a day<WH3117>'s journey<WH1870> on this side<WH3541>, and a day<WH3117>'s journey<WH1870> on the other side<WH3541>, round about<WH5439> the camp<WH4264>, and about two cubits<WH520> above the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH776>.

And the people<WH5971> rose up<WH6965> all that day<WH3117>, and all the night<WH3915>, and all the next<WH4283> day<WH3117>, and gathered<WH622> the quails<WH7958>: he that gathered least<WH4591> gathered<WH622> ten<WH6235> homers<WH2563>: and they spread<WH7849> them all abroad<WH7849> for themselves round about<WH5439> the camp<WH4264>.

While the flesh<WH1320> was yet<WH2962> between their teeth<WH8127>, ere it was chewed<WH3772>, the anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against the people<WH5971>, and Jehovah<WH3068> smote<WH5221> the people<WH5971> with a very<WH3966> great<WH7227> plague<WH4347>.
And the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> was called<WH7121> Kibroth-hattaavah<WH6914>, because there they buried<WH6912> the people<WH5971> that lusted<WH183>.
From Kibroth-hattaavah<WH6914> the people<WH5971> journeyed<WH5265> unto Hazeroth<WH2698>; and they abode at Hazeroth<WH2698>.
